thread.title: Marshawn Lynch’s mother clarifies her comments about Seahawks offensive coordinator Darrell Bevell
thread.title_full: Marshawn Lynch’s mother clarifies her comments about Seahawks offensive coordinator Darrell Bevell | The Seattle Times

author: Bob Condotta
title: Marshawn Lynch’s mother clarifies her comments about Seahawks offensive coordinator Darrell Bevell
text:
The mother of Seahawk running back Marshawn Lynch, Delisa Lynch, made headlines Monday with a Facebook post questioning the play-calling of Seattle offensive coordinator Darrell Bevell.
Thursday, she took to Twitter to try to clarify her comments, stating that the views were hers alone and she does not talk to Marshawn Lynch about football and that Facebook “may not have been the best platform” to state her feelings.
In her Facebook post Delisa Lynch specifically questioned the final call of the game, a zone read option on fourth-and-one when Marshawn Lynch was tackled for a one-yard loss.
In her Twitter statement Thursday, she said that as a fan she still wonders “what the coordinators logic was.”
Seattle picked up five third downs of two yards or less during the game on runs out of the shotgun.
pic.twitter.com/lS4JdJv31v
— Delisa Lynch (@MommaLynch24) September 17, 2015
Bob Condotta : 206-515-5699 or bcondotta@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @bobcondotta . Bob Condotta covers the Seahawks for the Seattle Times. He provides daily coverage of the team throughout the year.
